member.name: M:Polyfills.Polyfill.SplitAny``1(System.ReadOnlySpan{``0},System.ReadOnlySpan{``0})
member.summary: Returns a type that allows for enumeration of each element within a split span using any of the provided elements.
member.param: The source span to be enumerated.
The separators to be used to split the provided span.
member.returns: Returns a .
member.remarks: If is and if is empty, all Unicode whitespace characters are used as the separators. This matches the behavior of when and related overloads are used with an empty separator array, or when is used with an empty separator span.

member.name: M:Polyfills.Polyfill.SplitAny``1(System.ReadOnlySpan{``0},System.Buffers.SearchValues{``0})
member.summary: Returns a type that allows for enumeration of each element within a split span using the provided .
member.param: The source span to be enumerated.
The to be used to split the provided span.
member.returns: Returns a .
member.remarks: Unlike , the is not checked for being empty. An empty will result in no separators being found, regardless of the type of , whereas will use all Unicode whitespace characters as separators if is empty and is .

member.name: F:Polyfills.Polyfill.SpanSplitEnumeratorMode.None
member.summary: Either a default was used, or the enumerator has finished enumerating and there's no more work to do.

member.name: F:Polyfills.Polyfill.SpanSplitEnumeratorMode.SingleElement
member.summary: A single T separator was provided.

member.name: F:Polyfills.Polyfill.SpanSplitEnumeratorMode.Any
member.summary: A span of separators was provided, each of which should be treated independently.

member.name: F:Polyfills.Polyfill.SpanSplitEnumeratorMode.Sequence
member.summary: The separator is a span of elements to be treated as a single sequence.

member.name: F:Polyfills.Polyfill.SpanSplitEnumeratorMode.EmptySequence
member.summary: The separator is an empty sequence, such that no splits should be performed.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.UseParameters(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Define the parameter values being used by a parameterised (aka data driven) test.
Scenarios:
Verify.Expecto: Does not currently support `UseParameters()`.
Verify.Fixie: Automatically detects the method parameters via a custom ITestProject https://github.com/VerifyTests/Verify/blob/main/docs/parameterised.md#fixie.
Verify.MSTest: Does not detect the parametrised arguments, as such `UseParameters()` is required.
Verify.NUnit: Automatically detects the method parameters. So `UseParameters()` is not required unless using custom parameters.
Verify.TUnit: Automatically detects the method parameters. So `UseParameters()` is not required unless using custom parameters.
Verify.Xunit: Does not detect the parametrised arguments, as such `UseParameters()` is required.
Verify.XunitV3: Automatically detects the method parameters for built in types (string, int, bool etc), but for complex types `UseParameters()` is required.
In the scenarios where parameters are not automatically detected, an exception will be thrown instructing the potential need for Not compatible with .

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.IgnoreParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Ignore parameters in 'verified' filename resulting in the same verified file for multiple testcases. Note that UseParameters has still been called for test frameworks that don't support automatic parameter detection and the 'received' files still contains the parameters.
member.param: The names of the parameters to be ignored. When passing an empty list all parameters will be ignored.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.IgnoreParametersForVerified(System.Object[])
member.summary: Ignore all parameters in 'verified' filename resulting in the same verified file for each testcase. Note that the 'received' files still contain the parameters.
member.param: The parameters as you would have passed them to the UseParameters function.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.HashParameters
member.summary: Hash parameters together and pass to . Used to get a deterministic file name while avoiding long paths.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.UseHashedParameters(System.Object[])
member.summary: Provide parameters to hash together and pass to . Used to get a deterministic file name while avoiding long paths. Combines and .

member.summary: Use a custom directory for the test results.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.UseTypeName(System.String)
member.summary: Use a custom class name for the test results. Where the file format is `{CurrentDirectory}/{TestClassName}.{TestMethodName}_{Parameters}_{UniqueFor1}_{UniqueFor2}_{UniqueForX}.verified.{extension}`.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.UseMethodName(System.String)
member.summary: Use a custom method name for the test results. Where the file format is `{CurrentDirectory}/{TestClassName}.{TestMethodName}_{Parameters}_{UniqueFor1}_{UniqueFor2}_{UniqueForX}.verified.{extension}`.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.UseFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Use a file name for the test results. Overrides the `{TestClassName}.{TestMethodName}_{Parameters}` parts of the file naming. Where the new file format is `{CurrentDirectory}/{FileName}_{UniqueFor1}_{UniqueFor2}_{UniqueForX}.verified.{extension}`.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.VerifySettings.UseUniqueDirectory
member.summary: Use a directory for the test results. Where the file format is `{CurrentDirectory}/{TestClassName}.{TestMethodName}_{Parameters}_{UniqueFor1}_{UniqueFor2}_{UniqueForX}/{targetName}.verified.{extension}`.

member.summary: Use a directory for the test results. Where the file format is `{CurrentDirectory}/{TestClassName}.{TestMethodName}_{Parameters}_{UniqueFor1}_{UniqueFor2}_{UniqueForX}/{targetName}.verified.{extension}`.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.SettingsTask.UseTypeName(System.String)
member.summary: Use a custom class name for the CurrentDirectory results. Where the file format is `{CurrentDirectory}/{TestClassName}.{TestMethodName}_{Parameters}.{UniqueFor1}.{UniqueFor2}.{UniqueForX}.verified.{extension}`.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.SettingsTask.UniqueForRuntimeAndVersion
member.summary: Use the current runtime and runtime version to make the test results unique. Used when a test produces different results based on runtime and runtime version.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.SettingsTask.UseHashedParameters(System.Object[])
member.summary: Provide parameters to hash together and pass to . Used to get a deterministic file name while avoiding long paths. Combines and .

member.name: M:VerifyTests.SettingsTask.HashParameters
member.summary: Hash parameters together and pass to . Used to get a deterministic file name while avoiding long paths.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.SettingsTask.UniqueForArchitecture
member.summary: Use the current processor architecture (x86/x64/arm/arm64) to make the test results unique. Used when a test produces different results based on processor architecture.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.SettingsTask.UniqueForOSPlatform
member.summary: Use the operating system family (Linux/Windows/OSX) to make the test results unique. Used when a test produces different results based on operating system family.

member.summary: Automatically accept the results of the current test.

member.summary: Use the current runtime to make the test results unique. Used when a test produces different results based on runtime.

member.name: M:VerifyTests.SettingsTask.DontUseSplitModeForUniqueDirectory
member.summary: Dont use the current runtime to make the test results unique. Overrides .

member.name: M:IoHelpers.ResolveDirectoryFromSourceFile(System.String)
member.summary: Resolve directory path from a given source file path, this method will remap the path if the .dll was built on a system (e.g. Windows) and the tests are run on another one (e.g. Linux though WSL or docker)
